words.defineEn: considered to be of small importance or value
words.defineVi: được coi là có tầm quan trọng hoặc giá trị nhỏ

examples: News doesn't feel sacrosanct the way it used to.
This new show worries me, and not because Terry Gilliam's time-travel flick is sacrosanct.
words.defineEn: extremely important, to the point that it is not allowed to be condemned or changed
words.defineVi: cực kỳ quan trọng, đến mức không được phép lên án hay thay đổi

words.defineEn: (of language or music) clear and easy to understand
words.defineVi: (về ngôn ngữ hoặc âm nhạc) rõ ràng và dễ hiểu

examples: But, hey, not every egg-laying invader is sinister.
The world is full of larger lies, and more sinister liars.
That data collection did not strike me as sinister at the time.
And as the months wore on, Trump's message caught fire with a more sinister crowd.
It's not necessarily this kind of sinister grand plan.
words.defineEn: stemming from evil characteristics or forces; wicked or dishonorable
words.defineVi: xuất phát từ những đặc điểm hoặc thế lực xấu xa; xấu xa hoặc không trung thực
cố chấp bảo thủ và hẹp hòi
thể hiện sự đơn giản, non nớt hoặc thiếu kinh nghiệm

examples: But among them, Audi looks at first like an absolute laggard.
Most dogs will get really excited if you used a high pitched staccato voice.
words.defineEn: (music) marked by or composed of disconnected parts or sounds; cut short crisply
words.defineVi: (âm nhạc) được đánh dấu bằng hoặc bao gồm các phần hoặc âm thanh rời rạc; cắt ngắn sắc nét

examples: With about 7,500 metric tons of defunct spacecraft, spent boosters, and discarded equipment orbiting our planet at relative speeds up to 56,000 kilometers per hour, even small objects can be highly destructive.
That meant it was unable to rotate its antenna to check in with Earth, so the team ultimately had to declare the spacecraft defunct.

Right now we know of around 2,600 defunct satellites, 10,000 objects bigger than a monitor, 20,000 as large as an apple, 500,000 pieces the size of a marble and at least 100 million parts so small they can't be tracked.
words.defineEn: having ceased to exist or live
words.defineVi: đã không còn tồn tại hoặc sống

words.defineEn: peaceful and calm, not easily excited, irritated, angered, or upset
words.defineVi: hòa bình và bình tĩnh, không dễ bị kích động, khó chịu, tức giận hoặc khó chịu

examples: As the wind blew, the sweet scent of sassafras filled the air, creating a tranquil atmosphere.
My mind is like a tranquil pond, and I'm totally calm and at peace.
And the last portion of that affirmation is: "My soul is tranquil."
So, Prince Metternich’s ambitions for a tranquil citizenry had clearly failed to materialize.
Find tranquility in some way or another and then say this to yourself: My soul is tranquil.
words.defineEn: feeling calm and peaceful, without any disturbances or things that might be upsetting
words.defineVi: cảm thấy bình tĩnh và yên bình, không có bất kỳ sự xáo trộn hoặc điều gì có thể gây khó chịu

examples: It will be bleak.
A bleak pit of despair, that will crush your soul daily.
Yes, these numbers look bleak, but they are improving thanks to an increase in awareness and funding for immunization efforts, especially in countries like Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and Sudan.
But it was very bleak in terms of women on that Senate Judiciary Committee, which is a powerful committee.
And it was looking bleak as to what's going to go on.
words.defineVi: lạnh và ẩm ướt khó chịu

examples: Once again, when I imagine cancer, I think this is the way most researchers think about cancers, is the set of cells that have just gone berserk.

These are lifetime appointments, and I think that's why you saw the hard political left and all of its adjuncts, including many people in the mainstream media, go nothing short of berserk in trying to destroy a good man named Brett M. Kavanaugh.
words.defineEn: wildly frenzied and out of control
words.defineVi: điên cuồng và mất kiểm soát

words.defineEn: very sophisticated especially because of surfeit; versed in the ways of the world
words.defineVi: rất phức tạp đặc biệt là vì bề mặt; thành thạo trong các cách của thế giới

examples: Whatever meager rations remained were sent to the troops fighting the war, so the civilian population faced the brunt of the famine.
Remember, even the meager tides of a planet can rip moons apart.
Now Satyavan worked tirelessly to support their meager new life.
But they need more nitrogen and phosphorus than they can find in this meager soil.
- (Link) Oh, that's kind of a meager-- - Meager?
words.defineEn: deficient in amount or quality or extent
words.defineVi: thiếu về số lượng hoặc chất lượng hoặc mức độ

examples: But they don’t necessarily have to wait for an opportune moment to sneak in for a snack.

Normally, in the past, scores of sub-Saharan Africans could be seen along the road between Tangier and Ceuta making their way to and from camps deep in the forests near Ceuta, waiting for an opportune moment to enter the Spanish enclave.
words.defineEn: (of a time) ideal for achieving a particular purpose or reaching success
words.defineVi: (của một thời điểm) lý tưởng để đạt được một mục đích cụ thể hoặc đạt được thành công

examples: Can end at any moment when a drill instructor decides to order an impromptu cardio session.
- Using some extra, lengths of wire is impromptu cable ties to keep this mess under control.

"The average competitor was probably as well fitted for making a just estimate of the dressed weight of the ox, as an average voter is of judging the merits of most political issues on which he votes," he wrote To test this hypothesis, Galton turned the competition into an impromptu experiment.
Well, I thought that had all the mark of a relatively impromptu decision.

But even the theoreticians at the networks and the beloved New York Times and Washington Post and Wall Street Journal don’t really get it, that Trump can drive the agenda because he understands modern media, and he understands what’s disintermediated modern media, and that is Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and, quite frankly, the impromptu one-hour press conference, you know, outside of Marine One on the lawn of the White House.
words.defineEn: with little or no preparation or forethought
words.defineVi: với ít hoặc không có sự chuẩn bị hoặc suy nghĩ trước
